page.title: 04Corston Ch.Of All Saints 2
page.content: We interviewed the vicar,{Rev.Oswald, about the history of the church.It used to be a chapel attached to Malmesbury Abbey,which at the time of the{Domesday Book}owned the village of Corston.Very little of the old building remains-the church was almost entirely rebuilt in the nineteenth century.{The south doorway}dates from the fifteenth century,and the rood screen is also old.This has a lovely pattern of a vine covered in gilt along the top of it.{The pulpit}was made in the seventeenth century,and looks very solid.The oldest memorial in the church is to{Buck Gale,}who died in 1726 at the age of 81,who "lived on earth as a true disciple of christ,in humility,in wisdom,in goodness and in charity."
